result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A Stowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury, Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:14 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Ben Szilagyi.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Szilagyi - has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing argument by DA Christenson.  Sentencing argument by Atty Szilagyi.  Statement by the defendant.

COURT sentences the defendant to:

COUNT 3

-6 months county jail, consecutive to any other sentence the defendant is serving to commence immediately.  Court grants the defendant huber, out of county service and out of county travel.
-Court orders the court costs of $443.00 be reduced to a civil judgment.

Court grants the defendant 162 days of sentence credit.

Court adjourned at 1:21 p.m.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 13, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Atty Ben Szilagyi called and requested this matter be rescheduled as he has been appointed and is not able to make the 11/01 court date.  Rescheduled to December 13, 2016 at 1:00 p.m. at the request of Atty Szilagyi.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert A Stowe
Current: PO Box 586, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States  (Effective: 10-19-2016)
Prior: 430 E. Division St, C/O Waushara County Jail, Wautoma, WI 54982 United States

4:00 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to counts 1 and 3.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as repeater.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 3 as charged.  Court orders counts 2 & 4 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

COUNT 1

-6 months county jail, consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber - 60 days to commence.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-DNA sample

COUNT 3

SWD and places the defendant on probation for 24 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-DNA sample.

Court adjourned at 4:14 p.m.
Status hearing on May 3, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
